text: Bernhard Saarsoo (8 July 1899 – 29 June 1964) was an Estonian and Swedish physician and botanist. Saarsoo was born in Aaspere, Haljala Parish in northeastern Estonia. He published a number of notable papers on his studies in the 1930s including Uus robiheinaliik Eestis (1933) and Floristilisi märkmeid IV (1938). He lived and worked in exile in Växjö, Sweden since 1944 when he fled the Soviet occupation of Estonia. ==References== ==External links== *Article in journal Eesti Loodus Category:1889 births Category:1969 deaths Category:People from Haljala Parish Category:People from the Governorate of Estonia Category:Estonian botanists Category:Swedish botanists Category:Estonian physicians Category:Swedish physicians Category:Estonian World War II refugees Category:Estonian emigrants to Sweden Category:20th- century botanists Category:20th-century Swedish scientists Category:20th- century physicians
title: Bernhard Saarsoo
